metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3243 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
SOAPpy 0.12.5 does not properly detect recursion during entity expansion, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory and CPU consumption) via a crafted SOAP request containing a large number of nested entity references.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3243` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-soappy - 0.12.22-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python-soappy package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.12.22-1').
